result.execSummary:
The defendant Hunter L Kreger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

5/15/19 Probation is extended for 1 yr from 6/6/19 to 6/6/20, or until all court obligations, AODA treatment and Anger Management are completed , whichever comes first.
5/6/2020 Crt orders that as to count(s) 2 and 3 the term of probation is extended by 12 months 0 days or until completion of An AODA Assessment and completion of recommended treatment if
any.
5/28/21 Probation is extended on cts 2 and 3 for 30 days, or until completion of AODA assessment and recommended treatment.

miscConds.notes: $200 DNA surcharge remitted. $243  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Defendant is not to possess any type of dangerous weapon.

Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with CK unless she consents (in writing and PO agent agrees in writing).  Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence toward anyone. Ban from 6700 Lake Rd, Windsor, WI unless the PO agent approves in writing.
Completion of certified domestic violence treatment to be completed in the 1st year of probation.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
